item.title: Maui fire: 93 killed as governor warns of 'significant' death toll rise
item.description: Ninety-three people have been killed and hundreds are unaccounted for days after fires broke out in Hawaii.

item.title: Maui fires: Frustration mounts over relief effort
item.description: Some residents on the Hawaiian island are questioning why there is not more official aid.

item.title: Campsite car crash: Nine hurt in Newgale, Pembrokeshire
item.description: The car came off the road into the campsite at night and rolled into a tent and a group of people.

item.title: Pembrokeshire campsite owner on moment car rolled onto tents
item.description: A cot protected a baby from injuries after a car crashed into its tent, says the campsite's owner.

item.title: Talking to the Taliban: Right or wrong?
item.description: Whether world leaders should engage with the Taliban government is complicated, writes Lyse Doucet.

item.title: Zuckerberg says Musk 'not serious' about cage fight
item.description: Doubt hangs over the billionaires' fight plans, but Musk suggests he is open to a bout on Monday.

item.title: Ukraine war: Three-week-old baby and family among seven killed in Russian shelling
item.description: Russian shelling in Ukraine's southern Kherson region leaves seven civilians dead.

item.title: Pub takeaway drinks rules to be continued for 18 months
item.description: Landlords in England and Wales will be able to continue selling takeaway drinks through hatches under Covid-era rules.

item.title: Boy survives 100ft Grand Canyon fall after dodging tourist photo
item.description: The teenager suffered serious injuries when he plunged nearly 100ft (30m).

item.title: Thousands of war-era explosives buried at Cambodian high school
item.description: Thousands of unexploded munitions were discovered buried in the grounds of a high school.

item.title: Police search for teenage hillwalker missing in Highlands
item.description: The police, coastguard, and mountain rescue teams have been searching for missing Isaac Johnson.

item.title: Moises Caicedo transfer news: Chelsea agree £115m deal for Brighton midfielder
item.description: Chelsea agree a deal to sign Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo for a British record fee of £115m.

item.title: Women's Open: Protesters with flares halt play after making way on to 17th green
item.description: Play is halted briefly at the Women's Open in Surrey after protesters with flares make their way on to the 17th green.

item.title: The Papers: Baby in 'tent terror' and poor pupils 'hit hardest'
item.description: Monday's papers feature a baby escaping serious injury when a car crashed into a Pembrokeshire campsite.

item.title: New Zealand's youth vaping crisis clouds smoke-free future
item.description: As cigarettes are phased out, parents say new laws do little to address rampant vaping by young people.

item.title: Video doorbells: Police embrace them but do they cut crime?
item.description: The smart doorbells have soared in popularity, but they may not help reduce the number of break-ins.

item.title: Linden Farm: The family who turned a care home for adults with complex needs on its head
item.description: The Lawrence family were disillusioned with adult care homes when they hit upon a new idea.

item.title: Mortgage rates are falling - but don't celebrate yet
item.description: A number of lenders are cutting rates but experts say it may be too early to call it a turning point.

item.title: Netflix: How did it know I was bi before I did?
item.description: Tech recommendations can reveal more about us than we know ourselves - but how and why does this happen?

item.title: Migrant boats in the Mediterranean: Why are so many people dying?
item.description: The BBC explores the many reasons why the central Mediterranean is among the deadliest migration routes.

item.title: Perseid meteor shower lights up skies
item.description: Up to 100 shooting stars an hour were visible in one of the year's most anticipated astronomical events.

item.title: Can this battery-swapping electric scooter help clean up cities? We take a ride
item.description: We take a ride on a scooter powered by the world's largest battery-swapping network.

item.title: 'Harry Kane transfer made sense as Bayern Munich look to rekindle elite status'
item.description: Bayern Munich want to remain one of the hottest clubs in the world and Harry Kane's transfer is a sign of their intent, writes Constantin Eckner.

item.title: 'Don't Ask Why': South Korea grapples with back-to-back 'Mudjima' stabbings
item.description: Two random attacks have led to questions in a society otherwise known for its low level of violence.

item.title: Hip-hop at 50: The artists mixing it up and moving it forward
item.description: Emerging artists tell BBC Newsbeat how they're shaping the genre for the future.

item.title: The Crooked House: Mystery and anger surround wonky pub destruction
item.description: Former customers raise a glass to The Crooked House as they look for answers about its sudden demise.

item.title: Why US tech giants are threatening to quit the UK
item.description: Some tech giants feel they might have reached a "tipping point" due to new legislation.

item.title: Student finance: How much does university cost and does it increase earnings?
item.description: Given rising costs, some students are wondering whether going to university makes financial sense.

item.title: Fourteen days across the Atlantic, perched on a ship’s rudder
item.description: Four Nigerian stowaways set out for Europe on a tanker rudder. Two weeks later they were in Brazil.

item.title: Incredible photos of 'wee beasties' in Glasgow park
item.description: How lockdown helped David Hamilton discover his love for macro photography in a local park.

item.title: Harry Kane's move from Tottenham to Bayern Munich... in 76 seconds
item.description: The striker said he would always cherish the support he received during his time at Spurs.

item.title: Maui fire: Relatives of residents struggle to help from afar
item.description: Kaleikaumaka Johnson relives the horror of what happened in her home town of Lahaina, devastated by wildfires.

item.title: Ukraine war: Sex lives in focus for Ukraine's injured veterans
item.description: The charity ReSex is providing guidance for wounded soldiers looking for help with their sex lives.

item.title: China floods: The families torn apart by 'huge, furious waves'
item.description: Survivors recall seeing their relatives disappear in muddy torrents spawned by incessant rains.

item.title: Your results day guide for A-levels, T-levels and BTecs
item.description: When is results day, and what should you do if you don't get the grades you need?

item.title: Beauty spot selfies 'adding to mountain pressures'
item.description: Beauty spot selfie photos prompt others into the mountains, says park official, amid rise in rescues.

item.title: Miss Universe Organisation cuts Indonesia ties over sex abuse claims
item.description: Contestants complained they were unexpectedly asked to strip for body checks for scars and cellulite.

item.title: Bryan Johnson: Meet the multi-millionaire trying to reverse ageing
item.description: With a team of 30 scientists, tech entrepreneur Bryan Johnson spends millions on his body every year.

item.title: University marking boycott: Robert Halfon calls for talks to end dispute
item.description: Robert Halfon calls for new talks to stop the boycott continuing into the new academic year.

item.title: Steve Barclay calls talks with Scotland and Wales on cutting NHS waiting lists
item.description: The health secretary says Scottish and Welsh patients could be treated in England to cut waiting times.

item.title: Hawaii wildfires: Volunteers bring aid by boat to devastated Maui
item.description: Volunteers formed a human chain to pass aid off the boat as quickly as possible.

item.title: Amazon releases some seller funds after complaints
item.description: Amazon withheld some seller takings temporarily but is releasing them after some businesses came close to collapse.

item.title: Suspected package thief pulled from drain after drone finds hiding spot
item.description: Police used a drone to find the man after he tried to steal a package and caused a minor traffic accident.

item.title: Raphael Rowe: 'You can't repair the damage if you're falsely accused'
item.description: Raphael Rowe was convicted of a brutal murder in 1990 but was released 12 years into a life sentence.

item.title: Line of Duty's Vicky McClure announces marriage live on air
item.description: Vicky McClure and Jonny Owen reveal their wedding on his daughter's BBC Wales radio show.

item.title: NFL star Tom Brady greets Birmingham City fans at local pub
item.description: The seven-time Super Bowl winner has "made everyone's day," Birmingham City fans say.

item.title: Fake meat: As Beyond Meat sales fall, have we had our fill?
item.description: Fast food supplier Beyond Meat has seen its sales fall - but is it cost, taste or nutrition that is putting people off?

item.title: Huge cardboard building pops up in Newcastle city centre
item.description: The structure is made from 1,500 cardboard boxes and rises more than 45ft (14m) into the sky.

item.title: Watford Grandad finishes 1,650 mile bus trip round England
item.description: Stephen Chitty travelled the length and breadth of the country on 117 public buses for charity.

item.title: Fantasy Premier League: Gambling industry targets FPL players
item.description: A BBC investigation has found evidence that betting firms are sponsoring websites associated with the game.

item.title: Italy could host Musk v Zuckerberg cage fight
item.description: The culture minister says he has spoken to the X boss about hosting the showdown as a charity event.

item.title: Cheap picnic ideas: How to feed four on a £5 budget
item.description: Single mum Rachel shares her tips for creating picnic food for four on a £5 budget.

item.title: Moises Caicedo: Why Chelsea and Liverpool both wanted Brighton midfielder
item.description: MOTD2 pundit Danny Murphy says Chelsea's draw with Liverpool shows why both wanted Brighton's Moises Caicedo - before the Blues got their man.

item.title: The Hundred 2023: Jamie Smith helps Birmingham Phoenix beat Oval Invincibles for first win
item.description: Jamie Smith's maiden fifty in The Hundred helps Birmingham Phoenix to a 41-run victory over Oval Invincibles - their first win of the 2023 season.

item.title: Harry Maguire: Erik ten Hag says defender must prove he is top class or leave Man Utd
item.description: Erik ten Hag says Harry Maguire would be better leaving Manchester United if he is not confident enough to battle for a first-team spot.

item.title: Women's Open: Lilia Vu wins at Walton Heath for second major title of 2023
item.description: Lilia Vu produces a composed display to win the Women's Open at Walton Heath, the American's second major title of 2023.

item.title: 'Impediment or opportunity' - can Spurs find a new 'superstar'?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the beginning of the Ange Postecoglou era amid the backdrop of Harry Kane's exit at Tottenham.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: Pochettino brings 'full throttle' football to Chelsea
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Shay Given praises Chelsea's new "full throttle" style of play under Mauricio Pochettino following their 1-1 draw with Liverpool.

item.title: The Hundred 2023: Tom Banton's brilliant stumping leads plays of the day
item.description: Watch the best plays from Sunday's action in The Hundred, featuring Tom Banton, Harry Brook and Sophie Ecclestone.

item.title: Maps and images reveal Maui devastation
item.description: Satellite images and before-and-after pictures show extent of damage to town of Lahaina on Maui.

item.title: Four factors that made the fires so deadly
item.description: A combination of drought, high winds but also non-native grasses made the wildfires spread rapidly.

item.title: Hawaii fires: Jason Momoa warns tourists not to visit Maui
item.description: The actor says Hawaii is "not the place" for a holiday, as locals say tourists carry on as normal while tragedy unfolds.

item.title: Hawaii wildfires: Drone footage shows extent devastation in Lahaina
item.description: Charred trees, burnt out cars and collapsed buildings lie among the ashes left by the wildfires.

item.title: What caused the Hawaii wildfires?
item.description: What sparked the fires is still a mystery, but a mix of wind and dry weather helped the flames spread.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: As the cost of food continues to rise, we hear some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.

item.title: Interest rate and mortgages: What you can do about rising payments
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: What is happening to house prices, and could there be a crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am struggling to pay?
item.description: Many homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and what that calculation is used for.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: Renting: What are your rights as a tenant?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
item.description: Britain's economy is expected to shrink in 2023 but no longer expected to go into recession.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Interest rates: How a rise affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England decided to raise interest rates again in a bid to slow price rises.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.
